externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

info.description: Monitor traffic for Media Services Live solutions.
info.title: Akamai: Media Services Live Reports API

get.description: Retrieves Media Services Live 4 data for the given parameters.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

parameters.description: Use to limit report data to specific CP codes. Comma-separate several values.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: Identifies dimensions with comma-separated IDs.
parameters.name: dimensions

parameters.description: Identifies metrics with comma-separated IDs.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Specifies the end of the reported time range, expressed in `mm/dd/yyyy:HH:MM` format. The trailing `:HH:MM` 24-hour time segment is optional.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: Specifies the start of the reported time range, expressed in `mm/dd/yyyy:HH:MM` format. The trailing `:HH:MM` 24-hour time segment is optional.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The offset of the row for the start of data, `0` by default. Use this to request progressive batches of data. For example, you can make `10` requests for  `1000` records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. The default value is `300`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A UTF-8, URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data. See the [FilterParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-services-rpts/reference/filter-params) object for details on its structure.
parameters.name: filterParams

parameters.description: A UTF-8, URL-encoded JSON object representing sort parameters that rearrange reported data. See the [SortParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-services-rpts/reference/sort-params) object for details on its structure.
parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: Identifies a set of reported streams as comma-separated ID values.
parameters.name: streams

parameters.description: The time period in which to group each data record, expressed as number of seconds.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

columns.description: Indicates the time at which content was consumed. This dimension is set automatically.
columns.name: Time

columns.description: Total number of requests made to the entry point posting objects.
columns.name: Hits

columns.description: Encapsulates context for each element listed within corresponding `rows`.

index.description: Positions each column within the table.

name.description: Depending on the `type`, provides the name of the relevant dimension or metric.

metaData.description: Reflects the set of parameter values included in the request that determines this report's results.

aggregation.description: The time span included in each record, expressed in seconds.

endTimeInEpoch.description: The end of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

hasMoreData.description: Indicates that a constrained set of requested data doesn't represent the entire set.

limit.description: The maximum number of requested data `rows`.

offset.description: The offset of the row from which the data should start. Used with overall `limit`, it reflects where a batch of data starts. For example, setting both `offset` and `limit` to `100` selects rows 101-200 from the overall results.

startTimeInEpoch.description: The start of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

timeZone.description: Identifies the time zone from which the request was made.

rows.description: Encapsulates the report's two-dimensional table data. If there's no data to report, the array is empty.

200.description: OK. If the report yields an empty data set, the response yields an empty set of rows.

get.description: Retrieves Media Services Live 4 data stores for the specified parameters.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

dimensions.description: Indicates the time at which content was consumed. This dimension is set automatically.
dimensions.helpText: Indicates the time at which content was consumed. This dimension is set automatically.
dimensions.name: Time

dimensions.description: Identifier assigned to a contract associated with a particular stream.
dimensions.helpText: Identifier assigned to a contract associated with a particular stream.
dimensions.name: CP Code

metrics.description: Measures the quality of connection between Encoder and Entry Point. Provides connection level ratio of data packets(bytes) lost to the data packets(bytes) sent by Encoder.
metrics.name: Avg Packet Loss

aggregationInSeconds.description: Number of seconds for which data aggregates.

dimensions.description: Encapsulates dimensions for the data store. A dimension acts like a key in data exploration and answers questions such as who, what, where, and which. Each dimension object provides information on the ID, name, type, and description of the dimension.

id.description: A unique identifier for each dimension.

type.description: The type of dimension, either `standard` or `custom`.

id.description: Unique identifier for each data store.

maxQueryDurationInMinutes.description: Maximum number of minutes when you can query a data store. This system-imposed limit leads to better performance.

metrics.description: Encapsulates metrics for the data store. A metric is a numeric aggregation against one or more dimensions and answers questions on volume of activity or attack. Each metric object provides information on the name, description, and ID of the metric.

id.description: A unique identifier for each metric.

name.description: The name of the data store.

purgeIntervalInDays.description: Number of days for which the data store keeps data.

type.description: The type of data store, either `standard` or `custom`.

get.summary: List Media Services Live 4 data stores

The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).

dimensions.helpText: Indicates the time at which content was consumed. This dimension is set automatically.

dimensions.name: CP Code

metrics.description: Measures the quality of connection between Encoder and Entry Point. Provides connection level ratio of data packets(bytes) lost to the data packets(bytes) sent by Encoder.
metrics.name: Avg Packet Loss

aggregationInSeconds.description: Number of seconds for which data aggregates.

dimensions.description: Encapsulates dimensions for the data store. A dimension acts like a key in data exploration and answers questions such as who, what, where, and which. Each dimension object provides information on the ID, name, type, and description of the dimension.

id.description: A unique identifier for each dimension.

type.description: The type of dimension, either `standard` or `custom`.

id.description: Unique identifier for each data store.

maxQueryDurationInMinutes.description: Maximum number of minutes when you can query a data store. This system-imposed limit leads to better performance.

metrics.description: Encapsulates metrics for the data store. A metric is a numeric aggregation against one or more dimensions and answers questions on volume of activity or attack. Each metric object provides information on the name, description, and ID of the metric.

id.description: A unique identifier for each metric.

name.description: The name of the data store.

purgeIntervalInDays.description: Number of days for which the data store keeps data.

type.description: The type of data store, either `standard` or `custom`.

get.summary: Get a Media Services Live 4 data store

parameters.description: The unique `dataStoreId` value for the data store.
parameters.name: dataStoreId

get.description: Retrieves information about the entry point switches that occurred in a given time period.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

parameters.description: Use to limit report data to specific CP codes. Comma-separate several values.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: The timestamp string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The timestamp string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. The default value is `300`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The offset of the row for the start of data, `0` by default. Use this to request progressive batches of data. For example, you can make `10` requests for  `1000` records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Identifies a set of reported streams as comma-separated ID values.
parameters.name: streams

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

columns.description: Indicates the time at which content was consumed. This dimension is set automatically.
columns.name: Time

columns.description: Unique identifier associated with a stream generated by the Akamai provisioning workflow.
columns.name: Stream ID

columns.description: IP address of the Entry Point on which stream is ingested.
columns.name: Entry Point

columns.description: Type of stream - Primary or Backup.
columns.name: Stream Type

columns.description: Encapsulates context for each element listed within corresponding `rows`.

index.description: Positions each column within the table.

name.description: Depending on the `type`, provides the name of the relevant dimension or metric.

metaData.description: Reflects the set of parameter values included in the request that determines this report's results.

aggregation.description: The time span included in each record, expressed in seconds.

endTimeInEpoch.description: The end of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

hasMoreData.description: Indicates that a constrained set of requested data doesn't represent the entire set.

limit.description: The maximum number of requested data `rows`.

offset.description: The offset of the row from which the data should start. Used with overall `limit`, it reflects where a batch of data starts. For example, setting both `offset` and `limit` to `100` selects rows 101-200 from the overall results.

startTimeInEpoch.description: The start of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

timeZone.description: Identifies the time zone from which the request was made.

rows.description: Encapsulates the report's two-dimensional table data. If there's no data to report, the array is empty.

200.description: OK. If the report yields an empty data set, the response yields an empty set of rows.

get.summary: Get Media Services Live 4 entry point switch information

get.description: Retrieves HTTP Ingest Origin Shield data for the given parameters. You can query data collected at a one minute aggregation with ten percent sampling frequency and a purge window of seven days. The maximum duration is two minutes per query.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: Identifies dimensions with comma-separated IDs.

parameters.name: startDate

For example, you can make `10` requests for  `1000` records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. The default value is `300`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A UTF-8, URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data. See the [FilterParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-services-rpts/reference/filter-params) object for details on its structure.

parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: Identifies a set of reported streams as comma-separated ID values.
parameters.name: streams

parameters.description: The time period in which to group each data record, expressed as number of seconds.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).

columns.description: Content provider code (CP code) is an identifier assigned to a contract and used for reporting, billing, and monitoring traffic served.

columns.description: Total bandwidth usage including all HTTP response codes.

limit.description: The maximum number of requested data `rows`.

offset.description: The offset of the row from which the data should start. Used with overall `limit`, it reflects where a batch of data starts. For example, setting both `offset` and `limit` to `100` selects rows 101-200 from the overall results.

timeZone.description: Identifies the time zone from which the request was made.

rows.description: Encapsulates the report's two-dimensional table data. If there's no data to report, the array is empty.

get.description: Retrieves all data for Progressive Media Delivery.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Media Services Live Reports API

parameters.description: Use to limit report data to specific CP codes. Comma-separate several values.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: The timestamp string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The timestamp string in ISO 8601 format `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mmZ` or `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm+HH:mm`.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: __Enum__ Limits data to the type of traffic: `non-secure` for non-secure traffic, `secure-shared` for secure shared-certificate traffic, `secure-standard` for standard secure customer-certificate traffic, `secure-premium` for premium secure customer-certificate traffic, or the default `all`.
parameters.name: deliveryOption

parameters.description: Specifies if the API should ignore ingest data when generating the response, `False` by default.
parameters.name: ignorePutPost

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

columns.description: Content Provider Code (CPCode) is an identifier assigned to a contract and used for reporting, billing and monitoring traffic served.
columns.name: CP Code

columns.description: Encapsulates context for each element listed within corresponding `rows`.

index.description: Positions each column within the table.

name.description: Depending on the `type`, provides the name of the relevant dimension or metric.

metaData.description: Reflects the set of parameter values included in the request that determines this report's results.

aggregation.description: The time span included in each record, expressed in seconds.

endTimeInEpoch.description: The end of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

hasMoreData.description: Indicates that a constrained set of requested data doesn't represent the entire set.

limit.description: The maximum number of requested data `rows`.

offset.description: The offset of the row from which the data should start. Used with overall `limit`, it reflects where a batch of data starts. For example, setting both `offset` and `limit` to `100` selects rows 101-200 from the overall results.

startTimeInEpoch.description: The start of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

timeZone.description: Identifies the time zone from which the request was made.

rows.description: Encapsulates the report's two-dimensional table data. If there's no data to report, the array is empty.

200.description: OK. If the report yields an empty data set, the response yields an empty set of rows.
